Name: God Activity
Keywords: god activity massive class monolith
Description: Activity with 1000+ lines handling UI business logic and data
Bad Example: class MainActivity { fun fetchData() { db.query() } fun updateUI() }
Good Example: Split into ViewModel + Repository + Composable screens
Fix: Extract ViewModel for logic Repository for data

Name: Massive ViewController
Keywords: massive viewcontroller mvc god class
Description: ViewController handling all responsibilities
Bad Example: class HomeVC { func callAPI() func parseJSON() func updateUI() }
Good Example: Use MVVM-C with separate ViewModel and Coordinator
Fix: Extract ViewModel Coordinator for navigation

Name: Business Logic in Widget
Keywords: logic widget bloc provider build
Description: Business logic directly in widget build method
Bad Example: Widget build() { final data = http.get(...); return Text(data); }
Good Example: Use BLoC or Provider for business logic separation
Why Bad: Tight coupling impossible to test re-fetches on rebuild
Fix: Move logic to BLoC/Cubit inject via BlocProvider

Name: Prop Drilling
Keywords: prop drilling passing props deep nesting
Description: Passing props through many component layers
Good Example: Use Context or state management library
Why Bad: Makes refactoring painful components tightly coupled
Fix: Use React Context or Zustand/Redux for shared state

Name: Circular Dependencies
Keywords: circular dependency import cycle module
Description: Module A depends on B depends on A
Bad Example: moduleA imports moduleB; moduleB imports moduleA
Good Example: Use dependency inversion interface abstraction
Why Bad: Build failures unclear ownership infinite loops
Fix: Introduce interface in shared module

Name: Skip Layers in Clean Arch
Keywords: skip layer clean architecture shortcut domain
Description: Presentation layer directly accessing data layer
Good Example: Always go through domain layer UseCases
Why Bad: Defeats purpose of clean architecture hard to test
Fix: Create UseCase for each business operation

Name: Singleton Abuse
Keywords: singleton global state shared instance anti
Description: Using singletons for everything
Bad Example: object AppState { var user; var cart; var settings }
Good Example: Use proper DI with Hilt/Koin/Swinject
Why Bad: Hidden dependencies hard to test race conditions
Fix: Use dependency injection framework

Name: No Dependency Injection
Keywords: no di manual instantiation tight coupling
Description: Creating dependencies manually inside classes
Good Example: Use Hilt Koin Swinject or manual constructor DI
Why Bad: Tight coupling impossible to mock or test
Fix: Inject dependencies via constructor

Name: Anemic Domain Model
Keywords: anemic domain model no logic data class
Description: Domain models with only data no behavior
Bad Example: data class User(val name: String) // all logic in service
Good Example: Add domain logic to models: User.isValid() User.fullName
Fix: Put behavior with the data it operates on

Name: Feature Envy
Keywords: feature envy wrong class responsibility
Description: Class heavily uses another class methods/data
Bad Example: class OrderService { fun calc(cart: Cart) = cart.items.sumOf { it.price } }
Good Example: Move calculation logic to Cart class
Fix: Move method to class whose data it uses most

Name: setState Everywhere
Keywords: setstate everywhere rebuild widget state
Description: Using setState for all state management
Good Example: Use BLoC Cubit or Riverpod
Fix: Adopt proper state management solution

Name: Mutable Shared State
Keywords: mutable shared state race condition thread
Description: Sharing mutable state across threads/isolates
Good Example: Use StateFlow/LiveData or immutable state
Fix: Use immutable state + state management pattern

Name: Re-render Hell
Keywords: rerender performance usememo usecallback memo
Description: Unnecessary re-renders from poor state management
Bad Example: const App = () => { const [count setCount] = useState(0); return <ExpensiveList /> }
Good Example: Use React.memo useMemo useCallback properly
Fix: Memoize expensive components and callbacks

Name: State in Wrong Place
Keywords: state wrong scope local global misplaced
Description: Putting local state in global store or vice versa
Bad Example: Redux store: { modalOpen: false buttonHover: false }
Good Example: Keep UI state local share only what needs sharing
Fix: Local state for UI global for shared business data

Name: No Single Source of Truth
Keywords: duplicate state sync inconsistent ssot
Description: Same data stored in multiple places
Bad Example: var cachedUser in VM; var savedUser in Repo; var displayUser in UI
Good Example: Single source of truth with reactive streams
Why Bad: Data gets out of sync inconsistent UI
Fix: Use Room/CoreData as SSOT observe with Flow/Combine

Name: Direct State Mutation
Keywords: direct mutation state modify side effects
Description: Modifying state objects directly
Good Example: _state = _state.copyWith(items: [..._state.items newItem])
Why Bad: Side effects lost change history broken equality
Fix: Always create new state objects via copy/copyWith

Name: Missing Error State
Keywords: no error handling state loading empty
Description: Not handling loading error and empty states
Good Example: sealed class UiState { Loading Success Error Empty }
Why Bad: Users see blank screen on error no feedback
Fix: Use sealed class/enum for all possible UI states

Name: Storing Derived State
Keywords: derived computed state redundant duplicate
Description: Storing values that can be computed
Bad Example: var items; var filteredItems; var itemCount
Good Example: Compute filteredItems and count from items
Why Bad: State sync issues stale data extra storage
Fix: Use computed properties or selectors

Name: Blocking Main Thread
Keywords: main thread ui anr freeze jank block
Description: Doing heavy work on the main/UI thread
Good Example: Use coroutines/async with Dispatchers.IO
Why Bad: ANR dialog frozen UI dropped frames
Fix: Move heavy work to background thread/coroutine

Name: Hardcoded Strings
Keywords: hardcoded string i18n localization resource
Description: Hardcoding user-facing strings in code
Good Example: Text(stringResource(R.string.welcome_back))
Fix: Use string resources for all user-facing text

Name: Hardcoded Colors
Keywords: hardcoded color hex theme design system
Description: Using hex colors directly instead of theme
Good Example: Box(modifier = Modifier.background(MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary))
Why Bad: No dark mode support inconsistent theming
Fix: Use theme system colors

Name: Nested Scrolling Conflict
Keywords: nested scroll recyclerview scrollview conflict jank
Description: ScrollView inside ScrollView without coordination
Good Example: Use NestedScrollView or single LazyColumn
Why Bad: Janky scroll stolen gestures broken UX
Fix: Use single scrollable container

Name: Missing Loading States
Keywords: no loading state blank screen async
Description: Not showing loading indicators
Bad Example: if (data != null) show(data) // nothing while loading
Good Example: Show skeleton/shimmer while loading
Fix: Always show loading feedback for async operations

Name: Layout Shift on Load
Keywords: layout shift cls jump content pop
Description: Content jumping when images/data loads
Bad Example: Image loads and pushes text down
Good Example: Reserve space with fixed aspect ratio or placeholder
Fix: Use fixed dimensions or aspect ratio containers

Name: Ignoring Safe Area
Keywords: safe area notch cutout inset system bars
Description: Content behind notch or system bars
Good Example: Respect safe area insets on all edges
Fix: Use SafeArea/safeAreaInset/WindowInsets

Name: No Image Caching
Keywords: image cache memory network reload bandwidth
Description: Loading images from network every time
Good Example: CachedNetworkImage(imageUrl: url placeholder: shimmer)
Fix: Use Coil/Glide/Kingfisher/CachedNetworkImage

Name: Memory Leak in Callback
Keywords: memory leak callback listener retain register
Description: Registering listeners without cleanup
Good Example: Unregister in onStop/dispose/cleanup
Fix: Always unregister in corresponding lifecycle method

Name: Unnecessary Recomposition
Keywords: recomposition compose unstable lambda key
Description: Compose recomposing when it should not
Good Example: Use remember/derivedStateOf stable lambdas and keys
Why Bad: Wasted CPU jank poor battery life
Fix: Use key parameter stable lambdas Immutable annotations

Name: Large Bundle Size
Keywords: bundle size hermes ram assets tree shake
Description: App bundle too large
Good Example: import debounce from 'lodash/debounce'
Fix: Tree-shake imports enable Hermes optimize assets

Name: No Pagination
Keywords: no pagination load all memory oom list
Description: Loading entire dataset at once
Good Example: Use Paging3/pagination load 20 at a time
Fix: Implement cursor/offset pagination

Name: Synchronous Network Call
Keywords: synchronous network main thread block anr
Description: Making network calls on main thread
Good Example: withContext(Dispatchers.IO) { api.fetch() }
Why Bad: ANR frozen UI app killed by system
Fix: Always use async/await coroutines or callbacks

Name: Widget Rebuild Storm
Keywords: widget rebuild unnecessary build frequent
Description: Entire widget tree rebuilding on minor change
Good Example: Use BLoC/Consumer/Selector to scope rebuilds
Fix: Scope rebuilds to affected widgets only

Name: Not Handling Lifecycle
Keywords: lifecycle activity fragment destroy recreate rotation
Description: Not handling config changes and lifecycle
Bad Example: Store data in Activity fields lost on rotation
Good Example: Use ViewModel to survive configuration changes
Why Bad: Data loss on rotation crash on backgrounding
Fix: Use ViewModel + SavedStateHandle

Name: Retain Cycle
Keywords: retain cycle strong reference memory leak arc closure
Description: Strong reference cycle between objects
Good Example: Use [weak self] or [unowned self] in closures
Why Bad: Memory never freed app memory grows
Fix: Use [weak self] in closures that capture self

Name: Not Disposing Controllers
Keywords: dispose controller textediting animation scroll leak
Description: Not calling dispose on controllers
Good Example: @override void dispose() { ctrl.dispose(); super.dispose(); }
Why Bad: Memory leak resource leak potential crashes
Fix: Override dispose() clean up all controllers

Name: Missing Cleanup in useEffect
Keywords: useeffect cleanup subscription listener return
Description: useEffect without cleanup function
Good Example: useEffect(() => { socket.connect(); return () => socket.disconnect(); })
Why Bad: Memory leak zombie listeners stale callbacks
Fix: Always return cleanup function from useEffect

Name: Ignoring App Lifecycle
Keywords: background foreground app lifecycle pause resume
Description: Not handling app going to background/foreground
Bad Example: Keep timers and connections running in background
Good Example: Pause work on background resume on foreground
Fix: Use LifecycleObserver/AppDelegate/WidgetsBindingObserver

Name: Deep Nesting Navigation
Keywords: deep nesting navigation back stack levels
Description: Deeply nested navigation stacks 6+ levels
Bad Example: Screen A -> B -> C -> D -> E -> F
Good Example: Use flat navigation with tabs max 3-4 levels
Fix: Flatten navigation use tabs or modal for side flows

Name: No Deep Link Support
Keywords: deep link universal link app link url
Description: App has no deep linking support
Bad Example: Only navigate via taps inside the app
Good Example: Support deep links for all major screens
Fix: Implement deep linking from the start

Name: Losing Navigation State
Keywords: navigation state lost backstack destroy death
Description: Navigation state lost on process death
Bad Example: Navigate back and screens are blank
Good Example: Save and restore navigation state
Fix: Use SavedStateHandle/StateRestoration

Name: Hard-coded Routes
Keywords: hardcoded route string navigation typo
Description: Using raw strings for navigation routes
Good Example: Use typed routes or route constants with type safety
Fix: Use type-safe navigation

Name: No Back Handler
Keywords: back handler predictive back gesture exit
Description: Not handling system back properly
Bad Example: System back closes app from any screen
Good Example: Use BackHandler or predictive back API
Fix: Handle back press with confirmation

Name: No Offline Support
Keywords: offline cache first network connection
Description: App completely unusable without network
Good Example: Cache data locally show cached + sync online
Fix: Implement offline-first with local cache

Name: No Request Retry
Keywords: retry exponential backoff network failure
Description: No retry logic for failed requests
Bad Example: val response = api.getData() // fails once gives up
Good Example: Implement exponential backoff retry max 3 attempts
Fix: Add retry with exponential backoff

Name: Ignoring HTTP Errors
Keywords: http error status code ignore 4xx 5xx
Description: Not handling non-200 HTTP status codes
Good Example: Check status code handle 4xx and 5xx properly
Fix: Handle all HTTP status codes

Name: No Request Cancellation
Keywords: cancel request dispose viewmodel navigate away
Description: Not cancelling requests when leaving screen
Bad Example: API calls continue after user navigates away
Good Example: Cancel requests in onCleared/dispose/cleanup
Fix: Tie request lifecycle to screen lifecycle

Name: Trusting Server Data
Keywords: trust server validation input sanitize null
Description: Blindly trusting all data from server
Good Example: Validate and sanitize all server responses
Fix: Validate all fields handle missing data

Name: No Unit Tests
Keywords: no tests unit test coverage regression
Description: No automated tests in the project
Good Example: Write unit tests for ViewModels repositories logic
Fix: Start with ViewModel/BLoC tests then expand

Name: Hardcoded API Keys
Keywords: api key hardcoded secret exposed source
Description: API keys committed to source code
Good Example: Use BuildConfig/xcconfig/env vars and .gitignore
Fix: Store in local.properties/xcconfig never commit

Name: No SSL Pinning
Keywords: ssl pinning certificate mitm attack
Description: No certificate pinning for API calls
Good Example: Implement certificate/public key pinning
Fix: Pin server certificate or public key

Name: Storing Sensitive in Prefs
Keywords: sharedpreferences userdefaults plaintext sensitive token
Description: Storing tokens/passwords in plain preferences
Good Example: Use EncryptedSharedPreferences/Keychain/flutter_secure_storage
Fix: Use platform secure storage

Name: No Input Validation
Keywords: input validation xss injection sanitize
Description: Not validating user input
Good Example: Validate sanitize and escape all user inputs
Fix: Validate format length content of all inputs

Name: No ProGuard R8
Keywords: proguard r8 obfuscation minify shrink
Description: Not enabling code shrinking
Good Example: minifyEnabled true with proper proguard-rules.pro
Fix: Enable R8 with proper keep rules

Name: Logging Sensitive Data
Keywords: log sensitive password token pii debug production
Description: Logging passwords tokens or PII
Good Example: Never log sensitive data use redaction in production
Fix: Strip debug logs in release configure log levels
